benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Retrieve bundle custom fields

covered: Valid Request: Success cases for default and explicit audit levels (NONE, FULL, MINIMAL) are covered (TC01, TC02, TC03).
Empty Response: Case where a bundle has no custom fields is covered (TC04).
Invalid Input Handling: Invalid bundleId format and invalid audit values are covered (TC06, TC07, TC13).
Resource Not Found: Non-existent bundle returns 404 is covered (TC05).
Service Errors / Resilience: Scenarios for database/service unavailability and dependent audit service unavailability are included (TC09, TC16).
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempts are explicitly tested (TC17, TC18).
Edge / Load: Large result set / performance and concurrent requests are considered (TC14, TC19).
Response Structure & Content-Type: Response JSON array and Content-Type header checks are present (TC01, TC20).
Limits: Tests for minimum and maximum allowed custom fields are present (TC11, TC12).
Regression / Integration: Regression and integration-specific failure tests exist (TC15, TC16).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios exercise pagination, offset/limit or streaming for very large result sets; the standard guideline explicitly calls out pagination for GET.
Caching Behavior: No tests validate caching-related headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or cache semantics.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limits or behaviour when many requests are sent in a short time (distinct from concurrency).

Detailed Schema Validation: While "match expected schema" is mentioned, there are no explicit tests verifying each required/optional CustomField properties, types, nullability and constraints (e.g., id, objectType, fieldName, value, audit structure fields).

Response Paging / Size Limits: Tests don't verify behavior when responses exceed payload size limits or when query returns extremely large arrays beyond "maximum allowed" functional test — no resilience / truncation behaviour.
Cache-friendly Query Variations: No tests for conditional GET (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since) to confirm 304 responses.
Authorization Granularity: Only a basic unauthorized test exists; there is no test for insufficient permissions vs valid token (401 vs 403), or token scopes/roles.
Error Format Consistency: Error response schema/fields are not validated (e.g., error code, message, fields), only status codes are checked.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: include queries that would trigger paging (if supported) and assert pagination headers/body (limit, offset, next/prev links) and behaviour on large datasets.
Add caching and conditional GET tests: verify ETag / Cache-Control / Last-Modified headers, and conditional requests (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since) returning 304 where appropriate.
Add rate-limiting tests: send bursts of requests to validate 429 or other throttling behaviour and retry headers (Retry-After).
Expand schema validation: add tests asserting each CustomField property (names, types, required/optional, audit subfields) and that audit levels change the included fields exactly as expected.
Clarify and test authorization scopes: add tests for valid token with insufficient privileges (expect 403), expired tokens, and token scope variations if applicable.
Add error response schema checks: validate error payload format consistently across 4xx/5xx responses (code, message, details).

Add conditional and large-payload resilience tests: verify behaviour when payloads approach size limits and when many items are returned (streaming/truncation), and where applicable test retry/backoff behavior.
Differentiate concurrency from rate limiting: include both high-concurrency correctness tests (data consistency) and rate-limit/throttling tests (traffic shaping).
